TopicTitle: [WIP][1.8.x] SSTULabs - Low Part Count Solutions (Orbiters, Landers, Lifters) - Dev Thread [11-18-18]

Articles.Content:
Ah no, not sure how that old stuff got there. Learned a bit about module manager since then. Thanks for the patch, but running into a bug now I believe. Ignore first part of message.

Thanks for the lightning quick reply though

looking at the code i'd say the container does not exist:

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> | private void updatePersistentData() |
> | --- |
> |  | { |
> |  | if (containers != null) |
> |  | { |
> |  | persistentData = ""; |
> |  | int len = **containers.Length**; |
> |  | for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) |
> |  | { |
> |  | if (i > 0) { persistentData = persistentData + ":"; } |
> |  | persistentData = persistentData + containers*.getPersistentData();* |
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> *}*
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> *}*
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> *}*
>

> 7 hours ago, JoseEduardo said:
> 
> 
> what did you use to get this shot? it looks very cool ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")  
>   
> 
> the rocket also looks very nice, I wish I was that creative to not need RW replicas or replicas with some minor changes ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
> 

Thanks! The rocket, however, has been retired/completely lost since i started using 1.1. The Volga name lives on, though, because when i get my new 1.1 game/save stable, i've got a whole line of Angara-like launchers to be built and tested. I just wish i didn't have to depend on BobCat's Soviet Engines for the RD-191's and 0124's, but i don't mind -that- much.

To get the shot, i used Kronal Vessel Viewer and nearly all my patience trying to line it up at that angle. Than i took the rotate and moving gizmo's and moved stuff around/rotated things. Then the game crashed as i was about to take the screenshot  ┻━┻ ︵ヽ(`Д´)ﾉ︵﻿ ┻━┻

Eventually, i wrangled the screenshot into GIMP and stretched a usual 30 minute editing job to over ~4 hours to try to mimic ULA's DIVH infographic:

Spoiler

![MQ9wCyV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/MQ9wCyV.jpg)

> That LV is so absurd - you could do a Mars mission in 3 launches...

Oh, that wasn't even the biggest one. Try this, 300 tons to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> >:D

Spoiler

![5cjGkcb.png](http://i.imgur.com/5cjGkcb.png)

[@StickyScissors](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144204-stickyscissors/) speaking of Bobcat's engines, have you seen my SSTU Nova Pack? I left the RD-0124 out because for some weird reason I thought it was just a modernized RD-0110 with the same values....  

other than that they are all rescaled at 64% scale and matching thrust in order to be SSTU-alike  

I was also planning on adding the remaining stock engines (got Mainsail so far), but... No Man's Sky for PC is out, so.... yeah... eventually I'll get back to that ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

Its said on the last page. Kerbodyne plus! Many people noticed them. I have to admit they are the best. Say thanks to [@Bonus Eventus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/115722-bonus-eventus/)

I have to go check what i did to my stock inflatable heat shield. This is definitively <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>.

This is my SECTO-80t (single Engine Core To Orbit)

The <abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster"><abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster"><abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster"><abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster"><abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster"><abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster"><abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> have curve at 50% so the <abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio">TWR</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> is inaccurate for the 2 and 3 stage. Keep in mind that I play 6.4x and that everything is customized.

![Sr8xwkZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/Sr8xwkZ.png)

Reaching orbit insertion. Ended up with 1800 <abbr title="Delta-V"><abbr title="Delta-V"><abbr title="Delta-V"><abbr title="Delta-V"><abbr title="Delta-V"><abbr title="Delta-V"><abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> left after decoupling dummy 80t playload. I don't think I could have carryed much more since my <abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio"><abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio">TWR</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> is limit too low. 

![Ds8gMIx.png](http://i.imgur.com/Ds8gMIx.png)

And landing! I should carry more Mono. If I had I am sure I could have lander on the runway!

![HRGvXiB.png](http://i.imgur.com/HRGvXiB.png)

Total lunch cost for 80t: 200 000$ 

Out of curiosity, I will try a non-recoverable to see how much it would cost.

Edit: I was not expecting that, I am only saving 70 000 $ compared to a standard single use rocket.

SECTO-80t V2 have a lunch cost of 180 000$ so I now save 90 000$. If I would do a 2 stage recup SpaceX style I would save much more I believe.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-16T01:03:11Z" title="08/16/2016 01:03  AM" data-short="7 yr">August 16, 2016</time> by RedParadize**

So I decided to take my own advice, and instead of testing in stock, I reloaded k64.

I made an R7 with a Soyuz on top... and just got it into orbit, so clearly something is working ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") .

I then started messing with an Apollo copy (I need to make S1 and S2 a little smaller). Still, got me to the Mun 6.4X as far away tonight.

![OTW.jpg](http://i121.photobucket.com/albums/o222/tatersw/KSP/OTW.jpg)

Version 1 of this lander made it to the surface with a few hundred m/s to spare. In testing an Apollo-like staged take off, I left that valuable fuel on the Mun... I made orbit only with about half the pod's <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> to spare for docking. The next version got some extra fuel.

I made orbit only with about half the pod's <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> to spare for docking. The next version got some extra fuel.
> 

Do mods need any sort of patching to work with 64K? It looks intriguing, but if i have to add more crap on top of what i assume will be an already NRE-spammy install (~40 mods), i'm not gonna bother. My main concern being graphics mods like Proot's <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr>, because those seem to have...issues

I have SVE on, and I added SMURFF with it set to 0.64 except for the pods, which I set to 0. I don't know what others are using for their SMURFF settings for 6.4X, my goal was for an R7 with a Soyuz SM/DM/OM to make <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> with a little <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> to spare. Set to the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> value of "1" that combination makes it easily with the core stage retaining enough propellant to not want to throw it away.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, StickyScissors said:
> 
> 
> Do mods need any sort of patching to work with 64K? It looks intriguing, but if i have to add more crap on top of what i assume will be an already NRE-spammy install (~40 mods), i'm not gonna bother. My main concern being graphics mods like Proot's <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)"><abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr></abbr>, because those seem to have...issues
> 

You don't need a patch for 6.4k, but you will find that something that visualy match the SLS won't trow much into space. I rebalanced the engines on my part. They are stronger and lighter, but not has mutch as the original one. The result is that a SLS like will put a bit less than 80t into orbit.

Personalty I can't go back to stock. I would go to 10k or <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> but at that scale some bug are more likely, rover float over the ground etc...
If you apply that patch wont you end up with engines that have over isp over 600?

yup, just so the very same rocket design that works in stock can be used in a 10x kerbin or <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> with no other change to it, no increase or decrease of <abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio">TWR</abbr>, payload capacity or anything...  

it's either that or going for <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> (and needing to make specific configs for every part you want to use or hope someone else does/already did) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
I prefer my balancing then. But I don't think everything in it is legit. Anyway, we are sidetracking! Picture please!

Sure ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  

I've made the monsters as testbeds for the Nova pack, same thing for the Energia-DIRECT, the last design though is a "Saturn VI (Return of the Apollo)"  
  
[http://imgur.com/a/ICin4](http://imgur.com/a/ICin4)  

btw, imgur messed with the order during upload, so they are scrambled

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-16T15:33:47Z" title="08/16/2016 03:33  PM" data-short="7 yr">August 16, 2016</time> by JoseEduardo**

Oh I ended up doing a massive 2 stage 80t to orbit using your nova pack. With both stages fully reusable, it was soo big that it costed over a 1 000 000 $ to build. Would have been only 170 000 $ to operate if I didn't miss the LZ... Ended up being extremely expensive.

I don't think a rescale discussion is entirely off-topic. A user's guide to various rescales might not be a bad thing for us to bash out, anyway, as *we're* the ones using SSTU for that, not Shadowmage.

I used to use KIDS for 6.4x, below that I simply use stock parts. If we nailed down definitive settings, maybe with 2 options (a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch, vs a mod dependency like SMURFF with the cfg settings) for common rescales: 2X, 3.2X, 6.4X, and <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> (10X), this could become a readme. Last night I simply experimented, figuring that if an R7 didn't make orbit there was an issue. I wish the gravity turn mod was updated to 1.1.3, because it would make replicating launches easier for this sort of testing. That said, I made Saturn V that was fairly convincing looking with all the right parts except for the LEM, and it got to the Mun. I didn't bring it home yet, so I think the CSM likely has more <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> than it needs, which might mean a slightly lower SMURFF scaling than 0.64.

I want to say that [@blowfish](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/119688-blowfish/) had mentioned 6.4X someplace, I'll have to reread the thread.I was trying for as vanilla as possible.

[@RedParadize](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129285-redparadize/) if you're in career that hurts a lot, but if you're in sandbox then let someone else pay for it ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") (I could poke something in here, but I kinda don't want to violate the forum rules ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") )  
  
[@tater](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/119411-tater/) you could try tweaking the patch I posted, works pretty much like KIDS, except that it isn't as simple as KIDS to tweak...  

too bad KIDS was discontinued, it was very helpful ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

I'm on a few day ksp break since I flew out to CT for my dad's birthday with nothing but a phone. I'm hoping for down entertaining images ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") .

Typing on my phone... Not so fun.
